summary: This bill, the Counter-UAS Authority Security, Safety, and Reauthorization Act, focuses on regulating and improving the use of counter-unmanned aircraft systems (C-UAS). It reauthorizes and reforms existing C-UAS authorities, enhances transparency, security, safety, and accountability concerning these systems. Key provisions include defining terms, protecting facilities from drones, outlining FAA activities related to C-UAS, establishing pilot programs with local law enforcement, defining operator qualification and training, and setting up reporting requirements. The bill also places limitations on the use of C-UAS systems from certain foreign manufacturers and addresses drone safety statements.
